description.raw:
The `INTEGRATION_worlds_installed` test has been failing on default for the past 5 days with timeouts ([example build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-default-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/102/testReport/junit/(root)/INTEGRATION_worlds_installed/test_ran/)). I was able to reproduce the failure by clearing `~/.gazebo/models` so that it has to download all the models. I observed a run take over 400 seconds on my desktop with this procedure. So I've increased the test timeout to 700 seconds.

I tested this branch in jenkins before creating the pull request, and the test [passed in 4 min 15 sec](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/321/testReport/(root)/WorldsInstalled/checkWorlds/). Since this isn't the first test to run, I think other tests cause some of the other models to be already downloaded, which can explain why it didn't take the 400 seconds that I observed on my desktop.

In addition, I added a print statement with the name of each world file to aid in debugging. Before, it was failing with no console output at all.

I'll post additional jenkins results as they become available.
description.html:
The INTEGRATION_worlds_installed test has been failing on default for the past 5 days with timeouts (example build). I was able to reproduce the failure by clearing ~/.gazebo/models so that it has to download all the models. I observed a run take over 400 seconds on my desktop with this procedure. So I've increased the test timeout to 700 seconds.

I tested this branch in jenkins before creating the pull request, and the test passed in 4 min 15 sec. Since this isn't the first test to run, I think other tests cause some of the other models to be already downloaded, which can explain why it didn't take the 400 seconds that I observed on my desktop.

In addition, I added a print statement with the name of each world file to aid in debugging. Before, it was failing with no console output at all.

I'll post additional jenkins results as they become available.
